indicator_name: Passenger and freight volumes, by mode of transport
target_name: Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and transborder infrastructure, to support economic development and human well-being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all
indicator_available: Air passenger and air freight volumes
goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals metadata for target 9.1
computation_definitions:
Terminal passengers - All revenue and non-revenue passengers joining or leaving an aircraft at a United Kingdom airport.

Freight - The weight of other property carried on an aircraft excluding mail and passengers’ and crews’ permitted baggage. Freight in transit through the airport on the same aircraft is excluded.

Domestic services - Services flown entirely within the United Kingdom.

International services - Services flown between the United Kingdom and places outside.
graph_title: Air passenger and air freight volumes
source_organisation_1: Department for Transport (DfT) & Civil Aviation Authority
source_next_release_1: TBC: We plan to update indicator data within 4 months of data being released
source_other_info_1: AVI0102 - Air traffic by type of service, operator and airport (ODS, 42.6KB)
other_info: Data on Source only goes back to 2008. This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has not been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
